alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 2:33PM EDT until July 05 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern St. Marys County in southern Maryland... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 232 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wicomico River, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Lexington Park, Leonardtown, Piney Point, Tall Timbers, Saint Inigoes Creek, Saint Marys City, Saint George Island, Saint Clements Bay, Saint Marys River, White Point Beach, California, Patuxent River Naval Air Station, Bushwood, Abell, Valley Lee, Scotland, Great Mills, Avenue, Drayden and Saint Inigoes. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
